title: High Growth Tech Stocks in Asia to Watch August 2025
description: As global markets experience fluctuations, with the tech-heavy Nasdaq Composite recently finishing lower amid concerns about infrastructure spending on artificial intelligence, Asian markets have shown resilience, particularly in China where the CSI 300 Index reached a decade high. In this dynamic environment, high-growth tech stocks in Asia are drawing attention for their potential to capitalize on innovation and regional economic trends.
content:
As global markets experience fluctuations, with the tech-heavy Nasdaq Composite recently finishing lower amid concerns about infrastructure spending on artificial intelligence, Asian markets have shown resilience, particularly in China where the CSI 300 Index reached a decade high. In this dynamic environment, high-growth tech stocks in Asia are drawing attention for their potential to capitalize on innovation and regional economic trends. Click here to see the full list of 177 stocks from our Asian High Growth Tech and AI Stocks screener. Here's a peek at a few of the choices from the screener. Overview: Ninestar Corporation focuses on the research, development, production, processing, and sales of printers and printer consumables and accessories with a market capitalization of CN¥37.60 billion. Operations: Ninestar Corporation specializes in producing and selling printers and related consumables, leveraging its expertise in research and development to drive its business model. Despite recent financial setbacks, Ninestar shows potential in the high-growth tech sector in Asia. With an expected annual revenue growth of 14%, slightly outpacing the Chinese market average of 13.2%, and a forecast to transition from unprofitability to a robust earnings growth of 69.3% annually, Ninestar is strategically positioning itself for future profitability. The company's commitment to innovation is evident from its significant R&D investments, aligning with industry trends towards advanced technology solutions. Moreover, recent share buybacks totaling CNY 200.84 million underscore management's confidence in the company’s direction and value proposition, despite current challenges reflected in a half-year net loss of CNY 311.77 million and ongoing restructuring efforts aimed at optimizing operations and asset management.
• Get an in-depth perspective on Ninestar's performance by reading our health report here.
• Explore historical data to track Ninestar's performance over time in our Past section. SZSE:002180 Earnings and Revenue Growth as at Aug 2025 Overview: POCO Holding Co., Ltd. engages in the development, production, and sale of alloy soft magnetic powder and related components for electronic equipment, with a market capitalization of CN¥19.82 billion.
summary: The list of 177 high-growth tech stocks in Asia is being scrutinised for their potential to capitalise on innovation and regional economic trends. The list includes Ninestar Corporation, a company that specializes in producing and selling printers and related consumables, with a market capitalization of CN¥37.60 billion. Despite recent financial setbacks, Ninestan shows potential in the high-growing tech sector in Asia, with an expected annual revenue growth of 14%, slightly exceeding the Chinese market average of 13.2%, and a forecast to transition from unprofitability to a robust earnings growth of 69.3% annually, it is believed that this company is strategically positioning itself for future profitability.
shortSummary: Despite recent financial setbacks, high-growth tech stocks in Asia are showing promising prospects with strong growth prospects, driven by innovation and regional economic trends.

Co-Tech Development Corporation, together with its subsidiaries, engages in the production and sale of copper foil for printed circuit board industry in Taiwan and China. It is also involved in investment activities. The company was formerly known as Co-Tech Copper Foil Corporation and changed its name to Co-Tech Development Corporation in June 2014.

| Founded | Employees | CEO | Website |

| 2009 | 2,641 | Xiongzhi Guo | www.pocomagnetic.com |
POCO Holding Co., Ltd. develops, produces, and sells alloy soft magnetic powder, and alloy soft magnetic core and related inductance components for the downstream users of electricity electronic equipment. Its products are used in photovoltaic power generation, inverter air conditioner, UPS, energy vehicles, charging piles, and other areas. The company was founded in 2009 and is based in Shenzhen, China.

Ninestar Corporation engages in the research and development, production, processing, and sales of self-produced printers, and printer consumables and accessories. Its principal products include copiers, laser printers, laser printer consumables, printer main control SoC chips, consumable chips, industrial-grade/vehicle-grade microcontrollers, system-level chips, encryption chips, general printer consumables, and printing management services, as well as investment and management services. The company was formerly known as Apex Technology Co., Ltd.
